title: Katya Jones insists her second fall on Strictly Come Dancing was DELIBERATE
text:
Katya Jones has insisted that her second fall on Saturday's episode on Strictly Come Dancing was entirely deliberate and she was just making fun of herself.

The ballroom sensation, 30, took a spectacular tumble during her Cha Cha to It's Raining Men with partner Mike Bushell and just a few minutes later she stacked it again at the top of the stairs.

However, Katya took to Instagram after the show and reassured her followers that her second fall was just for show.

Speaking out: Katya Jones, 30, has insisted that her second fall on Saturday's episode on Strictly Come Dancing was entirely deliberate and she was just making fun of herself

Sharing clips of the fall, she wrote: 'Guys! This one was totally taking the Micky out of myself. How convincing is that? I should be a fall over actor!'

Katya also referenced the fall on Twitter and reassured fans she was 'fine' after her real fall.

The Strictly 2017 champion also denied questions from viewers that she was drunk after both falls.

She wrote: 'Guys! I’m totally fine! No idea what happened. So sorry. But so proud of @mikebreakfast for carrying on and delivering “the dolphin”!

Mishap: The ballroom sensation took a spectacular tumble during her Cha Cha with partner Mike Bushell, 53, and just a few minutes later she stacked it again at the top of the stairs

Slip; However, Katya took to Instagram after the show and reassured her followers that her second fall was just for show

'FYI I did it again on purpose in Claudia’s area! And im def not drunk as some people think.'

Katya also put up a message praising Mike, 53, for his performance on Saturday night's show and said 'who cares' that she fell.

She wrote: 'Look at this line! I’m honestly so proud of this guys! @mikebushelofficial you have improved so much! And no one can tell me otherwise!

'Who cares about my fall, can we appreciate how you delivered this fun, content filled cha-cha-cha with sharp clean movements, straight legs, good feet, improved posture AND carried on like a pro after my mishap!

Post: Katya took to Instagram and told fans she wasn't drunk after she fell during her performance

Setting the record straight: Sharing clips of the fall, she wrote: 'Guys! This one was totally taking the Micky out of myself. How convincing is that? I should be a fall over actor!'

Response: Dozens of Strictly fans took to Twitter to check is Katya was ok after the fall on Saturday's show

Reaction: Some viewers questioned whether Katya had had something to drink after watching her fall on Saturday's show

'I think this week you proved that just because we’re having fun, doesn’t mean we are compromising on technique. Keep doing what you’re doing! Keep bringing magic.'

After Katya and Mike's performance, judge Bruno Tonioli said: ‘It wasn’t quite magic, it was nearly tragic in parts.'

Katya insisted: ‘It wasn’t his fault!’ as she defended Mike. The pair finished third from the bottom with 18 points.

The first stumble happened just before journalist Mike was supposed to drag Katya in their routine, she then appeared slip and fall to the floor.

Doing fine: Katya also referenced the fall on Twitter and reassured fans she was 'fine' after her real fall

However the seasoned professional, who was wearing a sparkly blue dress and heels, quickly recovered and continued the routine.

After their cheeky performance, Tess Daley said: 'You slipped didn’t you, slipped on the confetti,' but Katya joked: 'He swept me off my feet!'

Saturday's episode was a success for other couples including Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse who wowed with their 'absolutely superb' Charleston routine to Trip A Little Light Fantastic from Mary Poppins Returns.

Happy: Katya also put up a message praising Mike, 53, for his performance on Saturday night's show and said 'who cares' that she fell

Criticism: After Katya and Mike's performance, judge Bruno Tonioli said: ‘It wasn’t quite magic, it was nearly tragic in parts.'

Score: Katya insisted: ‘It wasn’t his fault!’ as she defended Mike. The pair finished third from the bottom with 18 points

The actor, 35, did so well that Bruno Tonioli claimed they were 'as good as anything [he's] seen on the West End stage or on Broadway.'

And the pair did so well that they were rewarded with the first 10s of the season, as they earned an incredible 38.

Alex Scott and Katya's ex Neil Jones danced the first Rumba performance of the show, with a Moana theme.

Accident: The first stumble happened just before journalist Mike was supposed to drag Katya in their routine, she then appeared slip and fall to the floor

The judges praised Alex for the work she had put in for the dance, but did have a bit of constructive criticism for the pair.

Bruno recommended that she shouldn't have any 'hesitation' with her performance, and added: 'I think you do have it within you but it's not quite made that step, so come on honey show them.'

While Craig claimed that he could notice most of Alex's mistakes because she wasn't wearing any shoes, which 'magnifies the poor technique.'
description: The ballroom sensation, 30, took a spectacular tumble during her Cha Cha to It's Raining Men with partner Mike Bushell and just a few minutes later she stacked it again at the top of the stairs.
